name: Barcelona Universal Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -in the city center
reviews.title: Amazing hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -next to the metro station (L3 - the green one)
reviews.title: Good base to see the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -friendly staff
reviews.title: Barcelona Universal Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -very, very good breakfast
reviews.title: nice and clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -big rooms, clean bathroom and new furniture
reviews.title: Modern Hotel, Excellent Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The desk staff was very professional and the hotel is very classy. Located close to the subway, but in a sketchy area of Barcelona. Free internet connection, but wasn't always working during our stay. Upon checking in, we were told, "Breakfast is not included, but you can have it anyway." This to me means we get a free breakfast with our stay (we stayed 3 nights). Upon checking out we were slammed with a bill for 40 euros for our breakfast (there were 2 of us eating breakfast on one morning). The lady who checked us in happened to be behind the desk so I asked her if she remembered checking us in and telling us breakfast was incuded. She said yes, she did remember us and did remember saying that, but she meant we could PAY for breakfast. This was a very expensive misunderstanding that I feel was NOT our fault.
reviews.title: Breakfast mix up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, our stay was pleasant.
reviews.title: The Perfect Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had read reviews on this hotel before we took our trip. We were not disappointed. The hotel was much nicer than we expected. It even has towel warmers in the bathroom. Lots of closet space. We had neglected to bring our electrical converter with us but the desk had everything you could possibly need. The hotel is right across the street from four Tappas restaurants. We didn't know what that meant but although they were all very similar, the people are so funny and friendly that you want to eat at all of them. The food was very good, very hot and not pricey. We were a 10-minute walk from the statue of Columbus and the port and a 15 minute walk from Catalunya Square which is city center. Anything you want to do you can do from there. While the walk to Las Ramblas was a bit scary, nobody bothered us. It was only about 3 blocks. Las Ramblas between the hotel and the fountains at city center was fabulous, day or night. I would recommend this hotel to any and everybody. The reviews we read said to stay in the back because you are on a busy street but we never heard a sound and we were right in front on the 6th floor.
reviews.title: Great stay - creepy walk to Las Ramblas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We just had a great stay at the Barcelona Universal - the room was nice and the staff very friendly and helpful. It is quite a new hotel, so it immediately gives a good impression. There were, however, some things in our room that didn't work properly: the floorboards were loose and the wardrobe doors kept shutting itself - just annoying, no real problem. Quite good value, anyhow. No noise to speak of in our room, at least.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great staff, so so location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: We did not have breakfast included, so we found a nice place at the nearby square where we had great breakfasts for a fraction of the price the hotel charged. The neighbourhood, in general, is OK, but the walk to Las Ramblas is pretty interesting, so based on previous reviews, we opted for the tube after dark. The tube system is easy to figure out, and it is just a short ride to Las Ramblas.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location, nice staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I don´t hesitate to recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Great hotel but the not the best location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean, great staff, good breakfast buffet, nice skyline view from the roof pool, metro just outside the door.
reviews.title: Great Location and Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately we had an inside room without a window but the room was OK with a free safe deposit box.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maybe 15 minutes walk from the harbour/beach and 5-10 min walk from the Rambla. However, getting to the Rambla the shortest way means you must pass through the Raval. A not so pleasant neighbourhood with a lots of prostitutes and drug dealers.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We orignally booked Hotel Barcelona because of the great price and it looked like it was close to town. We were very happy when we arrived. The hotel is very nice (modern) great staff who were friendly and willing to help. They had free computers/internet to use and the best part was they are located on a main road so it was alway easy to find when we were exploring the city. Almost everything is within walking distance (exceptions are the obvious - Parc Guell, etc.) We were even able to walk to Montjuic!
reviews.title: FANTASTIC STAY
Good, not great
reviews.text: The rooms are clean, and service works fine. You've got comfortable walking distance to things from here, and we're not out late so we haven't noticed the neighborhood feeling dodgy or anything. But I wouldn't call the pond on the roof a "pool", and the breakfast would be fine for a three star hotel. Fine, not great. You've got a lovely selection of fresh fruit, your standard hot choices, juices and cereal, but the tea is bland and made from tap water, so only tastes of chlorine. The bread is toast or yeasty bakeoff. I've had a lot better from lesser hotels, in fact I'm used to better breakfast all over the world at hotels with fewer stars (and some with more). All in all, it's in no way a bad place to stay, but I'm not impressed either. Could be better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The lobby, guest rooms, front desk and bell staff were all very nice. Rooftop terrace is an added bonus with lounge chairs, small pool, and a few pieces of exercise equipment. Just steps away from a metro station and close enough to walk with wheeled luggage to the cruise ship bus stop. Close enough to La Rambla and Gothic Quarter to walk. Did not try the breakfast buffet. Even though we had rooms on the street side, the noise of the city did not bother our sleep.
reviews.title: I would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We came to Barcelona 3 days prior to our cruise and choose this hotel because of it's location bad reviews. Everything was just right - the location, the service in the hotel, our room was nice, clean & specious. A big plus is also complimentary Wi-Fi service. Very easy to get around the city by walking and by Metro which is right at the hotel entrance. Would stay there again and recommend it to my friends.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was friendly and helpful, rooms were large and clean. Breakfast was pricey but a good selection of items. Pretty close to La Rambla and the Gothic Quarter. Overall, a good value for what we paid.
reviews.title: Very Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I celebrated our 9th wedding anniversary by spending a few days in Barcelona. I must admit that I wasn't really that excited about going. However, now I wish I hadn't come back! Barcelona is superb! It is only a 2 hour flight from London. We flew Norwegian Airlines - a fairly new airline and pretty good I have to say. Nice leather seats making for a comfortable flight. We had private transfers to and from the airport and it literally took 15 to 20 minutes from the airport. There are cheaper options. You can take the Green Line bus to the train station and a taxi to the hotel. The bus costs 4 euros. You can take a shuttle taxi, sharing with fellow passengers or take a taxi from outside the airport.
reviews.title: Good hotel. Fantanstic Barca!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012
reviews.text: I took my boyfriend to Barcelona for his 30th Birthday on 6th Jan 2012 The hotel overall is a pleasant stay the rooms are spacious beds comfy but noise is an issue and seems to be noisy all the time. I did request a room higher up and I was given a room half way up. After paying for a double bed/room and asking for this on booking last august it was actually disappointing to find it was just two small singles pushed together, although the noise from shower toilet above was most annoying! Walk to la rambla is good 15 minutes, be aware of pick pockets in this area! Can from airport to hotel should be no more than €30. We did try and have dinner in hotel early evening but didn't open till 7:30 and on two attempts sat waiting at the bar for service which didn't come so we left and went into la rambla instead. Opium nightclub down by the port is awesome although fairly expensive, we had the best night in barca there. Tour buses are good although green route is much better than orange! Irish bar temple bar was also very good atmosphere. Restaurant 111 on La Rambla was a good choice!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, rooms noisy but reception staff very helpful. Bar staff non exsistant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here during the first week of December to help a friend plan their wedding. I have to agree with all of the positive reviews here - brilliant location, helpful staff, good value (we booked on Expedia and I think paid around £70 per night). We had a room overlooking the back (616) which was very quiet. We will be returning in June for the wedding itself and will be staying here again (and have recommended to other wedding guests).
reviews.title: Great value stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 3 night trip to this hotel and great City, had an amazing time, hotel reception staff were brilliant, Christian outstanding friendly service, moved us to a larger room with free champagne.
reviews.title: Birthday Weekend Treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you are a massive breakfast fan then fill your boots and enjoy the hotels selection for
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 15 euros, we however went to a cafe round the corner to the right (blue and white)and had toastados and coffee for 4 euros.
reviews.title: Good, modern hotel in a convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: 2nd visit to this great hotel. Located approx 10 minutes walk to the Ramblas or the Port. Comfortable rooms and free internet available.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be sure to ask to move if you are put in the central rooms that have no window to the outside. One of our group was and the reception oblidged. On slight downside is that one of our rooms was still not available at 15:30 on the arrival day.
reviews.title: Very good city break hotel and conveniently placed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a great hotel.
reviews.title: Only drawback was road noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Some great little bars nearby, try La Confiteria - turn right out of the hotel on the crossing.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, great value for money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also Le Petit Apolo on the road opposite (beer taps on the tables!!).
reviews.title: Modern hotel, good efficient service - not great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights and it was excellent value for the price. The location is fantastic - five minutes from La Rambla and there's an underground station outside. Arrived at about 11am and was able to check straight into the room and the receptionist offered me a map of the area and also warned about being careful to avoid pickpockets. The room (I was on the fourth floor) was a decent size and very clean and with modern decor. Bathroom was spotless and had a powerful shower. No problem with the air conditioning or noise from outside.There's free internet access on two laptops in reception, although they were a bit slow on occasion. The bar service was quick and friendly. I was room only so didn't try breakfast. Pool was closed for the winter but popped up and it looked like it would be an excellent sun trap with views across the city. Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Excellent for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've been to Barcelona many times before but this was our first time at the Universal. We booked our latest 4-night stay largely on the strength of the positive reviews on Tripadvisor but in view of the very low room rate (through the hotel's own website) we feared that it might be too good to be true. It wasn't! Everything about the hotel is absolutely first rate. At check-in the receptionist noted that I had requested a room with a view and allocated us room 820 which was at the (quieter) rear of the hotel and offered absolutely stunning views across the entire city and the mountains beyond. The room itself was smart, modern, spacious and spotless with a great bathroom where everything worked! Breakfast, served in the stylish restaurant,was delicious and varied. There is a comfortable lounge bar serving drinks and snacks at surprisingly reasonable prices for such a smart hotel. Staff were without exception courteous and helpful. All in all a superb base in this wonderful vibrant city - it will certainly be our first choice next time.
reviews.title: Best yet in Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tip - try the Bar Borrell about 200 metres up the road - it doesn't look much from the outside but it's full of friendly locals, the drinks are half the price of other bars nearby and the tapas are great!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here beginning December 2011 for 3 nights, B&B. We got a great rate from Booking.com.
reviews.title: Very good for the price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: On arrivel the receptionist was brilliant, very fast check in and then proceeded to ask if we had been to Barcelona before, we hadn't, so he grabbed a full street map and highlighted all the areas of interest, including where is the best places to eat both during the day and in the evening. So much information explained so easily by him.
reviews.title: Conveniently situated for Metro
Nice rooms but poor soundproofing
reviews.text: OK, the rooms were nice, and the staff were very professional, BUT for two nights in a row I hardly slept. I could hear everything, including the lift, the people above me walking around in their room, the drunks coming in late, the partying continuing in rooms further down the corridor, the other guests coming out to complain etc. Only go there if you want to party late and sleep late, or if you're deaf.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jill
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Oxford, UK
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.liked: — location, cleanliness, free luggage storage and safe when checked out for the day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An excellent hotel, near the heart of Barcelona, with very good service. I found a very big room, with excellent furniture. I would like to suggest it to all travellers in Barcelona
reviews.title: Great value, accommodations, service and location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Barcelona Universal Hotel for 3 nights on a trip with my mom and sister. Great for the price as got a good deal with Lastminute.com. We were given rooms next to each other on the 7th floor, didnt have any problems with noise but this is a city. Rooms were very clean, well equiped. We didnt eat or drink in the hotel. The bars and local "cafes" near the hotel offered great value for money and good for watching the world go by and were well used by local people. I would not recommend walking down Sant Pau as a link to La Rambla. The part near the hotel is fine, the bakery loveley but half way down you are in what appeared to be the red light area. Walk down Nou de la Rambla instead. Hotel is in a great location for exploring barcelona, a metro station outside the front door and approx 20 minute walk up to the Place de espayne, 10 minutes to La Rambla and 15 minutes to the port.
reviews.title: Great Hotel & Location
Nice but expensive, characterless and with some other problems
reviews.text: I spent 5 nights in the Barcelona Universal. I was initially very happy with the hotel, but did find myself becoming more disappointed each day, though overall I have to say it is acceptable. Its a business hotel. Not very homely.

reviews.title: A great place
reviews.text: The room was large enough, with two single beds and room to literally stretch your legs on all sides (should you care to do such a thing). I was satisfied with the cleanliness of the room, and I'm the kind of person who brings disinfectant wipes with me when I travel. The facilities; phones, net access, TV, minibar, AC, and safe were all modern. The bathroom too was comfortable. There is a free "office facility" on the 9th floor (2 PCs and printers) which might prove handy to you.

reviews.title: Nice and clean, bad neighbourhood
reviews.text: The staff were fine, though I wouldn't describe them as especially friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005
reviews.text: The area was I guess pretty good. I wasn't there to sightsee but I think the stuff you might want to see is fairly accessible on foot, plus there's a metro station directly outside the door. It is very noisy though. The street its on is very busy and stays that way until quite late/early. Also, an ambulance/police car blares past every 10 minutes - seriously. Now this is not too much of a problem as the windows do insulate from sound very well, but you just can't leave them open, which means you've got to run the AC all day. Those of you with any kind of green conscience may feel a little bad about that. Also, speaking of noise, running water in the neighbouring bathrooms can be heard quite clearly, though other than that internal noise is not a problem.
reviews.title: its ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005
reviews.text: Now the room service was frankly very poor. I didn't actually visit the restaurant, but the food I had sent up on several occasions would barely have been acceptable in a bar (pub grub). This is a four star hotel and they charge as such, so this was really quite unacceptable (of course I didn't complain ... wimp). Breakfast was okay, but at E13.50, or there abouts, a go it would want to be ... I thought it was included! Its just as well that house keeping decided to stop giving me those things to hang on your door to say what you want!
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Was marvellous and made our stay in Barcellona more pleasant. When we asked for the room to be changed cause outer rooms are more nosy this was done immediately. Breakfast was excellant and the staff were helpful and we had no troubled to communicate in english. I would suggest it to anyone and if i'll return to Barcellona i would go there again.
reviews.title: Marvellous stay

likes.disliked: — Internet connectivity - maybe it was my lack of knowledge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a modern hotel very clean and tidy with helpful staff. The rooms were very satisfactory nothing I could complain about. The Hotel is well located. The subway is all but a step away from the main reception and we could get about the city very easily. The harbour is about a 10 minute walk, for some good restaurants and walking at night was as safe as any other city.
reviews.title: Very good hotel both....

likes.liked: — Clean and tidy. Decor fresh and furniture new.
likes.disliked: — Noisy street but no real big issue.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008
reviews.text: The only disappointing aspect was the noisy street, but this didn't prevent sleep or cause distraction.
reviews.title: Excellent modern hotel in an excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel turns out to be just as all the previous reviews have said - the goods and the bads. Good location close to but far enough from busy tourist areas, subway station right at door, good restaurants/cafes nearby, noisy main street, modern room and lobby, competitive rates compared with other hotels - good value for money.
reviews.title: Meet expectation, good location, nice size room.

likes.liked: — reasonable price and nice size clean room
likes.disliked: — the bed is a bit hard, and lack of English TV channel

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel Choice
reviews.text: A laundry shop in the backlane of the hotel washes a bag of your clothes for 10 Euros that opens 9-1 and 4-8. I suspect the hotel itself sends its washings to the shop too - don't quote me on that :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in an ideal location, just two streets over from La Rambla. The Paral-lel metro station is located right in front of the hotel. It's about a 20 minute walk to Plaza Catalunya and 30 minutes to the beach. The staff was friendly and very resourceful, however, the 18 euro or so breakfast is not worth it as we decided to opt out after seeing the selection our first morning there. You'll have plenty of options around the area as there are many restaurants and cafes nearby.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013
reviews.text: The room was clean, bed was comfortable, however, it's located on a somewhat larger street so it was a bit noisy at night (mostly from sirens going by) but we slept through most of it.
reviews.title: No restaurant etc. but: great modern rooms and superb location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As per above and; very friendly reception. Haven't checked out pool yet but looks promising on pictures.
reviews.title: Our stay in Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: So many restaurants within walking distance that hotel doesn't need one.
reviews.title: OUR RECENT STAY AT THE BARCELONA UNIVERSAL HOTEL IN SPAIN

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: That's it really but Tripadvisor wont let me post until I've written 200 words :)
reviews.title: Average value for money. Satisfied but would try smithing else next time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Barcelona Universal Hotel for three nights on their special package and had an excellent stay. The package booked with the hotel included a bottle of sparkling wine on arrival ,breakfast and late checkout, good value for money.
reviews.title: Great city hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms were very clean and tidy and the beds were comfortable.We were in a room overlooking the main street but we did not find the street noise very bad as the double glazing was adequate.
reviews.title: Beautiful room, perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was good and staff very friendly, as were all the staff in the hotel
reviews.title: Above and beyond our expectations - Fantastic Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had evening meals in the hotel on a couple of nights and it was good value compared to many restraurants locally.It was a buffet meal and there was plenty of choice.
reviews.title: Great value !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Superb location, would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Location
modern but lacking character
reviews.text: my partner and i have visited barcelona several times and to our dismay found ourselves in a very modern hotel. very clean , staff friendly , but lacking any atmosphere. very buisness like with a mixture of suits and students. the pool was very small and along with the very small bar seating area we spent most of our time wandering around barcelona which was a shame because we were actually looking for a relaxing lie around as in the the past we have never had a hotel in barcelona with a pool. many couples at night when returning to the hotel went to there rooms for a half an hour and then returned to the bar area when seats were available. i cannot complain as such about this hotel but it states roof pool and i can only say if there were more than 4 people in the pool at once you may have bodily contact with strangers. but i suppose there might be a seat spare in the bar for a beverage.

reviews.title: It's a real shame
reviews.text: Having just had 4 days in Barcelona I am sorry to have to say that we will not be going back to the Barcelona Universal which is a great shame for the hotel because it could not be faulted. The rooms, standard of cleanliness and facilities (although the hotel were a little generous in their description of the pool as a 'swimming' pool) were everything and more a 4* hotel should be and the staff were some of the nicest and most professional we have met in our travels.

reviews.title: What a gem!
reviews.text: Leaving the hotel we always used the first street to the left to walk to La Rambla area and although there was a distinctly seedy feel to the place, we felt relatively safe due to the police station and numerous police in the area - the sheer number on view must say something about the nature of the area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005
reviews.text: The last reviewer remarked on the ease of travel using the Metro system. Our trip to Barcelona was one of a medical matter rather than a holiday and on the last but one day, we needed to cross the city and decided to take the metro from the Paral.lel stop which is immediately outside the hotel to avoid the huge traffic jams. Here we were physically attacked when getting on the train by two men of Arab appearance and my husband lost his wallet and contents but thankfully suffered no injuries. Within 5 minutes of the attack, large purchases totalling nearly £2000 had been run up on his credit card which seems to indicate that a very professional operation is being run with regard to stolen credit cards.
reviews.title: What a great city!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2005
reviews.text: We do speak Spanish and thankfully were able to cancel the cards within 15 minutes to prevent further loss, I was told when making a report at the police station that this area, and this station in particular, is one of the worst (ie dangerous), if not the worst, in Barcelona and when my husband explained to his dental surgeon why he had arrived late, the surgeon was horrified to hear that we were staying anywhere near the Raval District and, in particular, had ventured onto the Metro there.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Hotel
Difficult to find fault
reviews.text: The Barcelona Universal is not the largest hotel, or the best equipped or in the best location but it did offer friendly and efficient service, a very modern and up to date decor, large and comfortable rooms, all in a convenient location close to the centre and right next to a metro and bus stops.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005
reviews.text: The Universal gave us everything we needed for a weeks sightseeing in Barcelona : Breakfast that ran till 11.00am just in case we'd had a late night, a sun terrace on the roof with a (small) pool and gymnasium, although we didnt try the restaurant in the evenings preferring to enjot Barcelonas excellent nightlife.
reviews.title: Good accommodation in central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005
reviews.text: Its great value for money and if you are looking for a safe bet, with good service and a convenient location look no further
reviews.title: Nice hotel with good staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Barcelona Universal in mid August. We were very satisfied with the hotel and only had some minor niggles. The rooms and public areas looked exactly as they did on the Expedia website. It is a drab building from the outside but modern with contemporary design when you get inside. When we checked in at noon and requested a room on a high floor facing the back, we were told at reception that we could have one if we were prepared to wait until 2 pm. We waited and got room no. 819, which was perfect with regards to noise and view. It was a reasonable size but not exactly spacious. It offered what most travellers look for: a huge bed (a bit hard), safe, clean bathroom, hair dryer, air conditioning and TV with some international channels. The view was great, we could even see the Sagrada Familia! One complaint that I had, was that there was no electrical socket near a mirror, so I had to use my hair straightener using the reflection in the television. Even though it was a busy street, we had no noise in our room at night. However, the cleaners were quite loud in the morning so you could not have a lie-in beyond 9 am. We had a problem with the electricity in our room the morning after arrival, but it was fixed promptly. The breakfast was good and varied (although I missed normal fresh croissants), but expensive if not pre-booked. The small pool and sun deck on the roof were nice and usually very busy. The view was spectacular and we used this area to relax in the early evening on a couple of occasions. In some reviews it was mentioned that the neighbourhood is a bit dodgy. Well, the hotel is on a busy main road, so no safety issues here apart from the traffic. There are so many directions that you could go, that you can avoid walking through El Raval if you want to. I actually quite like this barrio, which has a lot of character with some nice shops, restaurants and bars, and I felt perfectly safe during the day. One observation: there were some prostitutes lined up at Carrer Tigre and on Sunday afternoon families gathered on benches nearby to watch them going about their business. Great free family entertainment for grandparents and their small grandchildren! Anyway, at night we would avoid this area and took a taxi to the hotel. The shortest walk to Las Ramblas was about 10 minutes and the metro was right outside the hotel. (We saw a lot of people jumping over the turnstiles here as the station is unmanned!)
reviews.title: Noisy, expensive, small rooms..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005
reviews.text: Overall, we can recommend this hotel as it offers clean and comfortable accommodation in a convenient location. We also got a very competitive price through Expedia.
reviews.title: Don't listen - the hotel is lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my second stay at this hotel, and aside from some minor irritations, we had an enjoyable time. For the price I don't think it can be beaten. We booked through the hotel's own website and got the early bird discount, only had to pay one night's deposit and got breakfast and a bottle of cava thrown in. All for just shy of £100 per night. Last time I stayed it was winter, so this time I made sure we visited the roof terrace. It really is a great sun trap, and it is a great way to get away from the bustling sounds of the city, and not too many people seem to realise it exists. The breakfast was fairly reasonable with a decent buffet selection, although I wouldn't have paid the 15 euro supplement had we been room only, as there are plenty of cafes locally. Why do people stuff their plates with the most disgusting concoctions? As usual in hotels, the toaster was really slow and didn't even brown my bread after four attempts. The staff were very helpful, although one member of staff was trying to recommend one bus tour company over another but we went with the other one anyway as the route was more suitable to our needs. We witnessed one member of staff being particularly patient with one couple who couldn't work out how when they needed to get to the airport for their flight. Used the free internet access a couple of times and they have got the latest Apple Macs, although do remember to make sure you properly log out of the whole system - otherwise the next person on will be able to access any email/Facebook accounts you've been using, even if you didn't click the 'save my password' box. We used the bar a few times on our way in/out of an evening, which was convenient and fairly well priced. Curiously though they don't do large beers - it only comes in 30cl glasses. We had to wait a couple of times for the barman to appear as well. The only slight downside of the stay was that we had a group of people on our floor for the first couple of nights who insisted on talking loudly to each other in the corridor. The rooms could do with soundproofing a bit more. But this is really nit picking and overall I'd really recommend using this hotel - it's fairly central (10 mins walk to La Rambla and the port), well priced with good facilities.
reviews.title: Another good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here for a short overnight visit to Barcelona prior to an early flight to the UK the next day.
reviews.title: Short but sweet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is great on Avda Paral but not too far up that it’s too far to walk to the Marina, Las Ramblas and the beach etc.
reviews.title: Good functional hotel in central location
Water pipe hell
reviews.text: The hotel itself was of a very high standard and staff clearly had the customer service skills to back it up.

reviews.title: Good location.
reviews.text: Our room was very spacious. We asked for a Triple room and got a double bed in the main room and a separate bed for a nephew in a separate living room which was perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005
reviews.text: Visited Barcelona many times, have been the victim of pick-pockets once before and was a little worried after reading the reviews. However, this hotel was great, location is good with the metro on the doorstep. The area is one of the more colourful in the city but never felt threatened at any time. I'm not taking away previous comments, Barcelona does have a problem with pick pockets but knowing this in advance makes you a little more careful.
reviews.title: No Problems Here...
Great Hotel - helpful staff
reviews.text: We had a great room for our 7 day stay on the 7th floor, noise was a problem on occassion but no worse than any other city centre hotel on a main road. Staff are really friendly and helpful and recommended along with booking some great restaurants for us. The views from the pool area are fabulous, the pool is small but great for cooling off and the sun loungers are a welcome addition. All in all, this hotel was great value for money and would stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005
reviews.text: We have just returned from an 8 day summer holiday in Barcelona and had a great stay at this hotel. Our room (top, back, requested by e-mail 10 days before travelling - thanks for the advice!) was excellent. The staff were always friendly and helpful. The area is great for getting around - it's not the most scenic location we never felt unsafe. Even the swimming pool (small but well done) and the gym (also small but 4 good machines) had their uses on occasion. The business centre was also very useful (and free!) If visiting Barcelona again I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Good Hotel
great hotel lots of hen and stag do's
reviews.text: I have yesterday returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel, and felt I should post this review immediately.

reviews.title: Loved this hotel
reviews.text: After reading earlier reviews I was a bit worried about the noise and surrounding area. However, neither turned out to be a problem.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really liked this hotel and being outside of the heavily touristy populated area of La Rambla. The view from the roof is amazing and the location (Metro station right out front/Funicular to Montjuic) is perfect. The hotel is clean and modern. Rooms are a bit small, but served their purpose. We were fist given a room that faces the interior and I cannot stand not having sunlight, so we were given a room on the 5th floor facing the street. The noise from the regular traffic wasn't bad....it was the police and ambulances that went by several times a day/night. To some this might be too much, but since I am from NYC, I'm used to the noise and it didn't bother me. I would say that noise is the only con of this hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect for a few days in BCN

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were some cute little bars/cafes behind the hotel that we didn't know about until our last night there. We also were fine walking through Raval at night. It was a little shady, a few homeless people, but just don't look at them, walk quickly and they will not bother you just like in any other big city.
reviews.title: Great hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009
reviews.text: We stayed at the Universal for 3 nights & were impressed by the cleanliness & location . The Metro station is at the door for the Nou Camp & funicular to the Olympic Stadium. A couple of great little cafes for drinks & breakfasts within 100mtrs. Only 10 mins max to Las Ramblas.
reviews.title: great weekend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travelled to Girona airport & took the Airport bus to Barcelona - about 1hr, then a 10Euro taxi ride from North Station to the hotel - 10mins. Everything was fine at check-in & they gave us various useful bits of information. Room was perfectly functional with everything you'd expect for a 4 star - air con, safe, toiletries etc & was spotless. My partner did comment that a mirror in the room would have been handy as the only one was in the bathroom.
reviews.title: fantastic location, wonderful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The tourist bus was very handy to see most of the city sights as was the Metro. All in all a great stay & we would stay here again on our return.
reviews.title: Excellent service, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I stayed at the Universal for eight nights at the end of July . I stayed with a friend in a double room. We payed €100 each per night, which is cheap considering the standard of the hotel.
reviews.title: Affordable and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is situated at the Parallel street, and has a subway stop right next to the entrace, which made getting around town a breeze - La Sagrada Familia is a five minutes subway ride away, and La Rambla is within walking distance.
reviews.title: Love the Hotel, give Barcelona a miss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room was spacious, with comfortable beds. It featured a minibar, tv, and all the essensial stuff. Nothing special in particular, just what you'd expect. The room was thoroughly cleaned every day.
reviews.title: Overall, a great place to stay

likes.liked: — Location, and the pool on the roof
likes.disliked: — Parking costs and rear room's view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But what really makes this hotel stand out is the roof - where you'll find a swimming pool and a sunbathing deck! Perfect if you don't feel like going to the beach.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, decent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, inside the hotel you get _free_ wifi access, which is a rarity these days. There's also a basic gym on the roof, and two computers available on the 9th floor where you can surf the internet - also for free.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC HOTEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our second stay at the Barcelona Universal. The rooms are very nice with a modern flair. There is only a short walk to Las Ramblas or the double-decker city tour bus stops. We really enjoyed the breakfast buffet with it's wide selection of choices. The front desk staff was great and really helpful in answering our questions and giving directions. The only drawback was the internet connection that was slow and clunky. But we were supposed to be on vacation so we were able to survive. We recommend this hotel whenever you're in Barcelona.
reviews.title: Vacation In Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from Barcelona and we had stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. First, the location is very convenient. We book this hotel because we are on a cruise and need a hotel close to the port. This hotel situated in the parallel ave. And we can just walk down to the monument of Christopher Columbus to catch the little blue bus and can arrive to the port in 5 minutes or so for just 2.50euro per person. We also get on the metro from the station just a few steps from the hotel and go 3stops to plaza de catalunya to do all the shopping and sightseeing. The one trip fare is 2 euro per person and basically you can spend all day there walking up and down the Gracia ave. And if you only have 2 days in Barcelona, the best bet is to get on the open top bus the first day that you can pop in and out of the various attractions or take a full trip with 2 or 3 different routes depend on the bus company so you know what you want to see the following day or just look through the map and choose the attractions that you want to see first because the bus only run in one direction and it takes a whole route back in order to get back to the last stop. Also the hotel is basically one block from the Rambla where you can find all the little shops and tapa restaurants.
reviews.title: Good location, clean hotel, good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel room is modern, clean and spacious. The hotel staff is very friendly and is always willing help you with all your questions in English which is an extra to people like us that don't understand Spanish.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Bad Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: It is a very good experience and for sure we will return to this hotel and highly recommend this hotel to everybody.
reviews.title: Second time,still great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is fantastic, but unfortunately not in a great area. The rooms are huge, everything is clean and stylish. The roofdeck provides a nice view and the gym is a great perk. I read other views about the noise level being bad, but since we were in an interior room on the 7th floor, we didn't have that problem at all. I travelled with my friend (a fellow savvy city-dweller) but as two girls we felt incredibly uncomfortable walking around after dark. Even though Las Ramblas is just a 5 minute walk from the hotel, the streets leading there (through El Ravel) are narrow, dimly lit and packed with a dodgy sort who heckled us and made us feel incredibly uncomfortable. We were constantly warned by hotel staff and surrounding police that we were in danger of getting pick pocketed around the hotel, which didn't ease our concerns. We ended up taking the metro (which was conveniently located in front of the hotel) and cabs a lot, but would have preferred to walk. If I were to travel to Barcelona again I would stay on the other side of Las Ramblas.
reviews.title: city breakers from london

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at this hotel was really enjoyable for several reasons. It was well located - with the Metro stop being right outside the main entrance. This usually meant you could get to any of the major attractions within 10 minutes. The Metro in Barcelona is superb, and very reasonably priced. It also meant that if you decide to get the airport bus into Barcelona, the Universal is only two stops from your drop off point.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel were helpful and always polite. They were happy to speak English despite our best efforts to converse in Spanish.
reviews.title: Universal in May

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is quite expensive, so make sure you check to see whether you have already paid for this. It was approximately 21Euros for breakfast, but I much preferred to go to a local cafe ion the morning for a coffee and croissant for 2 Euros.
reviews.title: Very happy with the Barcelona Universal Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool on the roof is very relaxing, and has nice views.
reviews.title: A non-smoking hotel in Spain that actually IS non-smoking!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Basically, if you want to enjoy yourself in this great city, then the Universal will make you feel completely relaxed and at ease. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

description: Strategically located just a five-minute walk from Las Ramblas, Hotel Barcelona Universal grants its guests easy access to all parts of the city. Metro lines 2 and 3 stop just outside the main entrance, at “Paral·lel,” and nearby buses can take you to the beaches of Barcelona, Park Güell, and anywhere in between. A stroll from our hotel near Las Ramblas will take you to some of Barcelona’s favorite tourist attractions.Hotel opened in 2001 and renewed in 2011.Hotel Barcelona Universal has 167 rooms, each equipped with free Wi-Fi Internet. Three “Barcelona Skyline Suites” feature a Jacuzzi and private terrace. Families and larger groups may be accommodated in triple or superior rooms.
